summary:
Pray for the Wicked by thegingermidget 
Pairing: Villaneve
Rating: È
Tags: Mildly dubious consent, rope bondage, knife play,...
body:
Pray for the Wicked by thegingermidget

Pairing: Villaneve

Rating: È

Tags: Mildly dubious consent, rope bondage, knife play, mild blood play, Dark Eve, Post Season/Series 02, Smut, Branding, Mentions of Blood, Top Eve Polastri, Implied/ Referenced Drug Use

Summary: It has been a year since Villanelle shot Eve, and Eve hasn’t been able to stop thinking about her. This obsession has led Eve down a dark path, one with a single ending. Eve tracks down Villanelle and she even she doesn’t quite know why.

Excerpt:

Villanelle had the audacity to smile at her with bleary eyes. “You made it very clear that you didn’t want me. And that’s why I’ve left you alone.”

She tried to sit up in bed and learned her arms and legs were tied. With that strange sense of humor they now shared, Villanelle laughed harder.

Villanelle did her best to right herself but didn’t get very far. When she gave up, she relaxed into the sheets with a luxurious sigh, as though there was no place she would rather be. “I knew you’d come back to me. I knew you were mine.”

Eve stepped to the edge of the bed, knife held loose in her hand but kept out of sight. “That’s not true.”

The fatigue, the drugs, the hilarity of the situation she found herself in made Villanelle verbose. “Then why are you here? Why did you track me down? I’m nothing anymore, Eve, no one. If you cared about tracking down assassins and righting wrongs you would be anywhere else. But you are nothing too. Nothing without me.”

summary: whatever happens on ke in terms of storytelling has nothing to do with sandra or jodie's jobs. they are actors on the show. they...
body: whatever happens on ke in terms of storytelling has nothing to do with sandra or jodie’s jobs. they are actors on the show. they are not writers. don’t blame them for things they can’t control. don’t be a dickhead online. if don’t have anything nice to say just shut the fuck up. also, ke isn’t queerbait, stop throwing that word around. both villanelle and eve are canonically queer women and their mutual attraction has been confirmed numerous times on the show and in several interviews with the series creator, miss phoebe waller-bridge. don’t let shitty journalism and quotes out of context get to ya. and if you don’t like what you’re watching, then stop. make constructive criticisms instead of throwing around hateful commentary online just cause you are not getting what you want. be kind and intelligent please. bye.

reblog.comment: whatever happens on ke in terms of storytelling has nothing to do with sandra or jodie’s jobs. they are actors on the show. they are not writers. don’t blame them for things they can’t control. don’t be a dickhead online. if don’t have anything nice to say just shut the fuck up. also, ke isn’t queerbait, stop throwing that word around. both villanelle and eve are canonically queer women and their mutual attraction has been confirmed numerous times on the show and in several interviews with the series creator, miss phoebe waller-bridge. don’t let shitty journalism and quotes out of context get to ya. and if you don’t like what you’re watching, then stop. make constructive criticisms instead of throwing around hateful commentary online just cause you are not getting what you want. be kind and intelligent please. bye.

Favorite female characters: Jodie Comer as Oksana Astankova/Villanelle in Killing Eve (2018-)

summary: PSY 153: Psychology and the Law (Killing Eve Fic) Chapter 4
title: PSY 153: Psychology and the Law (Killing Eve Fic) Chapter 4
body:
AO3 Link
Chapter [1] [2] [3]

Chapter 4: Two Sides of the Same Coin

One of the biggest reasons Dr. Polastri and Dr. Astankova were both so well respected was the experience they brought to their jobs. Before coming to teach at the university, Dr. Polastri had worked in law enforcement doing criminal profiling, specifically focused on piecing together the work of serial killers as well as identifying the overarching character traits common amongst them. It was common knowledge that years before coming to the university, she had played a crucial role in the apprehension of a prolific female serial killer who had been haunting the streets of London for many years. She never talked about it, but when students searched her name, videos of old interviews came up and news articles written about how the successful investigation had launched her fledgling career straight into the higher ranks of MI6.

Dr. Astankova had worked for a major law firm that did big cases for huge companies and extremely wealthy individuals. She’d handled scientific jury selection, going out and surveying communities and putting together detailed statistics on how to pick the best jurors based on social and character traits in order to manipulate them into getting the desired verdict, regardless of the evidence. Her success rates had been remarkably high, far better than the standard for the field. She had never revealed what specific cases she had worked on, but it was suspected that she had been responsible for getting some potentially very bad people off the hook for major crimes.

They both had stories that were creepy and forced people to seriously question the darker side of human nature. It was two different perspectives, but ultimately they were two sides of the same coin and as time went on they began to meld together quite well and the class became a new and exciting experience every day.

When they had taught separately, those stories were what drew people to sign up for their classes; they were what kept people coming to class every day. And that was still true once they were sharing the class, but there started to be new reasons as well.

They were fun together. They spent a lot of time bickering like children on a playground, but they were smart and their comebacks weren’t just sassy, they were intelligent and people learned things from them. Once, it was Dr. Astankova’s lecture day and she was talking about the steps for manipulating emotions and empathy in a jury and suddenly her fellow lecturer stood up, stopped her in the middle of a sentence and flat ou told her she was wrong and there were seven reasons why. They fired back and forth until the next class started trickling in.

And no one minded. It was applicable, not just for the students who intended to go into careers in psychology or law, but for everyone, just in their everyday lives. And it was fun. People liked them and they especially liked them together.

———-

They always bickered when they put together their lectures.

“I will slap you if you put that picture in the slides.” Eve said.

“Okay then I’m definitely putting it in the slides,” Oksana replied, resizing the image.

Eve rolled her eyes. “Not helpful.”

Oksana chuckled and bumped her knee against Eve’s. “Will you slap me if I take it out?” Eve just groaned. Oksana’s finger hovered over the delete key, eyebrows raised, “Is that a yes?”

Eve sighed and leaned in to kiss Oksana’s neck before whispering in her ear, “Maybe, but we have to actually finish this first.”

Oksana deleted the image.
body_abstract:
AO3 Link
Chapter [1] [2] [3]

Chapter 4: Two Sides of the Same Coin

tags: i'm not gonna lie it's a crack filled crossover
summary: This is your badness level killing eve x lilo & stitch crossover  . To Villanelle's utmost displeasure, Lilo pulled out a...
body:
This is your badness level

killing eve x lilo & stitch crossover 

.

To Villanelle’s utmost displeasure, Lilo pulled out a notepad from the pile of papers beside her and began to outline the figure of a woman. She craned forward to see Lilo’s handiwork and was surprised by the rough sketch of arms and legs wearing Villanelle’s clothes, from her black leather jacket, right down to the golden rings on her hands. There was also a frowny face scrawled onto the circular head.

“This…is your badness level.”

Lilo grabbed a red pencil and drew a line skimming the top of Villanelle’s head, cutting off her eyes and forehead from the rest of her body. With quick shading, she had coloured her in red all the way down to her strappy sandals. The she flipped the notepad around to display her artistic skills.

“It’s a rough estimate. I read your file on the flight over, and I’m not going to lie, it’s pretty high on the scale. But not the highest I’ve seen.”

Villanelle bristled at the thought that there was someone out there with a higher badness level, and wondered how much better at their job they were.

read more

killing eve x lilo & stitch crossover 

.

To Villanelle’s utmost displeasure, Lilo pulled out a notepad from the pile of papers beside her and began to outline the figure of a woman. She craned forward to see Lilo’s handiwork and was surprised by the rough sketch of arms and legs wearing Villanelle’s clothes, from her black leather jacket, right down to the golden rings on her hands. There was also a frowny face scrawled onto the circular head.

“This…is your badness level.”

Lilo grabbed a red pencil and drew a line skimming the top of Villanelle’s head, cutting off her eyes and forehead from the rest of her body. With quick shading, she had coloured her in red all the way down to her strappy sandals. The she flipped the notepad around to display her artistic skills.

“It’s a rough estimate. I read your file on the flight over, and I’m not going to lie, it’s pretty high on the scale. But not the highest I’ve seen.”

Villanelle bristled at the thought that there was someone out there with a higher badness level, and wondered how much better at their job they were.

read more

summary: Can I just ramble about killing eve a moment
body:
Can I just ramble about killing eve a moment

Topic: Shepard’s pie.

So I fucking love how every little thing in this show means something. At least I think it does, maybe i’m just thinking about it too much BUT I FEEL LIKE THE REPEATING MENTION OF SHEPARD’S PIE is a metaphor for the fact that the people in eve’s life don’t know her and don’t really try to understand her as she’s meant to be understood.

Allow me to explain.

Shepard’s pie is made a lot by Niko. Maybe because he thinks eve really likes it. Maybe that’s all he knows how to cook. Who knows. The point is. We see it a lot. But we never see Eve actually really eat it. We’re never shown him making it for eve and her being genuinely grateful for it.

First time it appears. She has it as leftovers for lunch. She swaps it with bill for his wife’s sushi. She’d rather have that. (In my mind this signifies that bill was the closest to seeing eve as she truly was, as shown by this gesture. RIP BILL)

Next. Villanelle breaks into eve’s house the first time and asks for dinner. Eve heats up shepard’s pie. V eats it. Eve only takes a tentative bite when v demands she do so.

Nothing in that dialogue or motion suggests eve likes the food in front of her. And yet. Villanelle assumes it’s her favorite. Enough to ask Niko how to make it in s2.

This doesn’t really catalyze to me as important until the finale. V asks eve what she wants her to make for her for dinner. We have to assume she wanted eve to say shepard’s pie. After all, she had gone through the effort of learning the recipe. But eve says spaghetti. To me, this means that villanelle loved nikos shepard’s pie and, because she sees eve as like herself rather than an individual person with her own motives and inner conflicts, she assumed eve does as well.

V only knows what eve wants when it matches what she herself wants, otherwise she’s lost.

And no one ever actually asks eve if this thing they assume she wants actually IS what she wants.

Thank you for coming to my weirdly specific ted talk

summary: It was an odd choice to have Villanelle bored by artwork in the museum, save for one gruesome one. She loves exquisite things,...
body:
It was an odd choice to have Villanelle bored by artwork in the museum, save for one gruesome one. She loves exquisite things, so why wouldn’t she be drawn to classic works of art? Why wouldn’t she like art museums?

Was she just like performing boredom so Konstantin wouldn’t feel smug?

All characters I love I like to project a love of visual art and art museums maybe, but I just feel in my core that Villanelle would love art museums.
